title: Ashley James attends Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil premiere in London
text:
Ashley James ensured all eyes were on her as she walked the red carpet at the Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil premiere.

The former Made In Chelsea star looked incredible in a purple tiered frock as she mingled with a host of stars at the European Film Premiere in London on Wednesday night.

The 32-year-old star was a vision in the intricate ruffled dress, which boasted an asymmetric, one shoulder neckline.

Pretty in purple: Ashley James ensured all eyes were on her as she walked the red carpet at the Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil premiere in London on Wednesday night

Ashley let her dramatic dress do all the talking, wearing her blonde hair pulled back in a low bun.

She accessorised with a pair of glittering silver earrings and matching bracelets and opted for natural looking make-up.

The star pulled out all the stops for the event, hosted at the Odeon Imax.

Striking: The 32-year-old star was a vision in the intricate ruffled dress, which boasted an asymmetric, one shoulder neckline

Ashley recently appeared on the Jeremy Vine show to debate the right to have NHS funded IVF.

During her appearance, Ashley claimed that she felt single people were 'attacked' for their relationship status, due to the fact studies have shown there is no difference between children raised in a one or two parent home.

When asked if she was planning to have a child in the near future, Ashley said: 'I'm not yet, but I have a couple of friends, one who is 38 and one who is 39, one is going through the adoption process by herself and the other is having IVF.'

She argued that the service is something that should be allowed for free, she said: 'I agree the NHS is on its knees, I'm not disputing that, but the question is where do we draw the line? If We're only going to give life or death situations NHS use.'

Gorgeous: Ashley let her dramatic dress do all the talking, wearing her blonde hair pulled back in a low bun

Another guest on the show argued that IVF is very expensive and the success rate is low, therefore why should the health service pay for something that doesn't work.

Ashley argued that because she pays her taxes she should be able to gain funding from the NHS, comparing it to a smoker who has developed cancer.

She said: 'But lets say when I'm 38 if I do want to have a child and I've paid all my taxes, why should someone whose smoked all their lives, knowing the risks get treated for cancer, so I feel it's a very complex thing.'
description: Ashley James ensured all eyes were on her as she walked the red carpet at the Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil premiere.
